topic.title: Adding Video, Audio, and Embedded HTML Resources

keywords.indexterm: XML documentsAuthor Mode editingAdding media resources
Adding media resources in Author Mode

body.p: You can insert references to media resources (such as videos, audio clips, or embedded HTML frames) in your DITA, DocBook, or XHTML topics. The media resources can be played directly in Author mode and in all HTML5-based outputs. There is a toolbar button () that allows you to insert and configure a reference to the media resource. You can also drag media files from your system explorer or the ProjectNavigator view and drop them into your documents (or copy and paste them).

section.title: Adding a Media Resource
section.p: To insert a media resource in a document, use the following procedure:

ol.li: Place the cursor at the location where you want the media resource.

Select the Insert Media Resource action from the toolbar. A Chose Media dialog box appears.You can also drag media files from your system explorer or the ProjectNavigator view and drop them into your documents (or copy and paste them).
Select the URL for the media resource and click Ok.

section.p: Result in Author Mode: A reference to the specified media object is inserted and rendered in Author mode so that it can be played directly from there.
section.note: On Mac OS X, if you receive a Blocked Plug-in error message, you need to updated your Flash Player to the latest version.
section.p: Result in Output: In the publishing stage, the media object is converted to an HTML5 element so that it can be rendered properly and played in all HTML5-based outputs.
